Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2008 07:35PM - edited Jun 14, 2008 07:37PM by Sierra Hi Cupcake: You have wonderful input here from the gals. I am up tonight and just wanted to send out some very gentle hugs for you It is a good idea to keep a diary, a paper trail of all, as you will forget, everything becomes blurry, with so much Try try to take one day at a time and get some meds for the anxiety if needed I did I am at 8 yrs now, Grade 3 and very blessed, and there are many other survivor/thrivers here Try to stay near positive folks Treat yourself real good! Look to your HIGHER POWER/Spiritual Resources for support O/T.. Hi Shirlann: YOu are a youngster.. take care LOL Sierra :))

Posts.Title: Depressed Bliz Bliz

Posts.Content: May 14, 2008 12:15PM - edited May 14, 2008 12:19PM by Sierra Hi there: I am 8 yrs out and still have some neuropathy in fact, of late.. it is odd but in that baby toe, it never did leave.. however, it used to start there and go right up the leg also have it on my surgery arm inside.. that soft skin.. just tingles and feels like pins going into it Keep telling the doctors I was sent to a specialist..but no nerve damage but I can tell you, I can not use my right hand for more than l5 minutes I do hope it goes away we are all different I would mention that, as this is visible people often look at me, and think oh, I can not see it, you look fine to me They actually think I am lying.. it appears, but not so.. :)) Best on this rest your arm There are groups on line for this Hugs, Sierra Aching Toes Numb Soles or similar.. by John Seneff B6 I did not want Neurontin was allergic to it

Posts.Content: May 23, 2008 07:48AM Sierra wrote: Hi Kira: All the very best to you as you move forward Nice to be a doctor and also have this extra input from your friends in the medical arena I just wanted to add: My DX was year 2000 my lump was 3.5 cm.. Grade 3.. 1 node positive I was offered both but v. afraid to lose my breast and of course went with the lump chemo aggressive Tx and rads Now I am coming up .. to 9 yrs.. in 2009.. There is a big dent in my breast I have small breasts and did not want more surgery, just wanted to move ahead I am older than you and some of the gals in fact, I dont wear a bra now.. to heck with that, they bother me.. I would add: there were some who said.. masectomy should have been chosen for me, It always comes back etc.. however we go with what is best for US HUGS OUT TO YOU Sierrs
Posts.Title: lumpectomy vs. mastectomy? kira Shirlann

Posts.Content: May 12, 2008 08:09AM - edited May 12, 2008 08:10AM by Sierra I was v. seldom ill but took Kytril (many yrs ag) decadron (taxol) and.. Always kept soda crackers in purse Gravol I do know it is v. important to take this EXACTLY WHEN THEY tell you to.. do not wait I had all my meds lined up on the table :) drinking coke or ginger ale Best to you on your journey Get after the doctors to change this, or help you Hugs :))
Posts.Title: anti-nausea drugs mary6204 leaf

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2014 12:18PM - edited Mar 8, 2014 12:19PM by Sierra Hi there: I sent you a pm so, quite a bit in that again, so sorry to hear this and, can u get some meds to help you thru this i did all TX in Toronto (l4 yr survivor) and so much help available i had counselling but, sure had my crying days a nurse to the house, and Wellspring here I am very sorry about your horses, they have to be the most beautiful creature, my heart melts when I see one take good care, drink lots of water I did a vitamin regime, under care of naturopath and consulting with my oncs write anytime I am a Christian, and prayed each night to my Higher Power, it helped me greatly Namaste Sierra Ontario :)
